alert.note: Alert for Golden Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 05 at 8:18PM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Montana... Musselshell River near Lavina affecting Golden Valley County. Musselshell River near Shawmut affecting Wheatland County. .Heavy rainfall over the weekend, combined with the Musselshell River already flowing high with snowmelt, may result in minor flooding at times this week. In addition to the flood potential, the potential for significant bank erosion is very high with water flowing at these levels. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Musselshell River near Lavina. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low lying areas near the river is possible. Significant bank erosion is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Monday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Despite a recent plateau of the Musselshell River at Lavina, forecasts still expect it to rise to just below FLood Stage by Tuesday evening. Over the next few days, any rain shower or storm that occurs over the river will likely bring it into flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Musselshell River Lavina 9.5 8.6 Mon 7 pm 9.3 8.6 8.3 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Do not enter or cross flowing water or water of unknown depth. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe due to erosion. A Flood Watch means that flooding is possible. Now is the time to prepare for action in the event flooding occurs. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon by 1215 PM MDT.
